name: places/ChIJgWS0sJlZwokRzfQR5lGa3yQ
formattedAddress: 99 University Pl # 8, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 99 University Pl # 8, New York, NY 10003-4528, USA

originalText.text:
I had a chronic cough, was rapidly gaining weight because I couldn't exercise. And by "chronic" I mean I could not laugh, take a deep breath, or go more than a minute without coughing. He sent me to an allergist and when that turned up nothing, told me to lose weight and everything would be fine, I trusted him.

Turns out during those years he blamed that cough on my weight, he missed the lump growing in my chest. By 24 I was diagnosed with Stage 4 breast cancer with lung metastasis which judging by the timing of my cough, I have had since I was around 16/17 years old. I couldn't work out to lose weight, I couldn't even breathe.

There was no reason this should have happened and if you have a daughter I recommend steering clear.

Which is a shame because the nurses and receptionists are some of the most amazing people I have ever met. But Dr. Bourne himself has no buisness being a doctor to any young woman past puberty.

The excuse that a patient was too young for cancer no longer stands.

Especially because he also deemed that my scoliosis wasn't in need of correcting so my spine is also permanently curved. Which means that to this day it hurts to stand upright for too long and I have had to pay for physical therapy to help with the pain.

Thanks Doc!

originalText.text: The best there is. Dr. Bourne is very knowledgeable, charismatic, patient, caring, and professional. His staff/nurse are also a pleasure to deal with and extremely accommodating. My children have been a patient of Dr. Bourne from birth and I'm happy to have both children under his care.

text.text: The best there is. Dr. Bourne is very knowledgeable, charismatic, patient, caring, and professional. His staff/nurse are also a pleasure to deal with and extremely accommodating. My children have been a patient of Dr. Bourne from birth and I'm happy to have both children under his care.

originalText.text: We're going to miss Dr. Bourne  very much.  Best pediatrician I've ever known!
